column4: ubuntu now has 60% of my hdd space and windows only has 40% :D I'm slowly making the transition (if only games were a little more stable in linux I'd be 100% linux) :D :D :D
!ask
!wireless > Perezz
!help > euzao
time for a windows-style updates reboot :P brb
i use ndiswrapper for my laptop but my situation is that the internet went down, after it came back up the wifi isnt being picked up on the laptop
i use ndiswrapper for my laptop but my situation is that the internet went down, after it came back up the wifi isnt being picked up on the laptop
have ye tried to reboot since the network went down?
yes a bunch of times

hmm, have you tried resetting your modem/router? My wifi tends to get a little crazy during say, a power outage or blip in the connection during outages and usually a quick reset of both modem and router clears it up.
did that as well :/
sorry :( I'm all out of ideas lol, wireless in linux is like 2 boys dancing, it just ain't right :(
it happed after the new update
what model wifi you use?
its this intel wifi link 5100, i use ndiswrapper
I've always heard Intel are THE KINGS O LINUX SUPPORT as far as drivers in linux go. You sure there's no native drivers for it so you can dump NDISWrapper?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Intel%20WiFi%20Link%205100
i purchased a lenovo t400 last month
ouch :( looks like I was misinformed back when I was having wifi issues and everyone was "Oh! Buy and Intel card, they're super supported in Ubuntu!" lol
i just booted up in a different kernel
my wifi works now :/
lol
welkommen to linux! :)
